Black Butler is an Anime were you can definitely get lost in, especially the story and characters.  From the very first episode you will instantly fall in love with the characters, and the story will keep you on the edge of your seat with suspense, but also has you on the ground laughing.   If you are a big fan of crime, suspense, humorous, with a little bit of horror than this is the anime for you.  The only problem I have with the show is that their are some questions that are still not answer, or the answers take to longto get answer, plus the show doesn't get good until around the 4th episode, but all the episodes after 4 keep getting better and better.

Criteria 
Story: 7
The story of Black Butler is quite intricate yet simple at the same time. This is because it is mainly set up into 2-4 episode arcs each with their own story yet also able to connect to the next arc and the previous arc. To put simple though the story basically revolves around a boy named Ciel Phantomhive who lost his parents at a young age and made a contract with the devil to exact revenge on those who killed them. Each arc has a little bit to do with the main story of finding the one who killed his parents even thougheach arc still has its own story.


Ending: 4

Even though I liked the story of Black Butler I found the ending absolutely atrocious, it just build up so much hype and emotion and then just ends.  There is really no way to explain it without ruining it so I won’t explain it. Just understand the only thing we wanted to see and thought we would see, we don’t see. They show us the event proceeding it but then when it comes to the main event it just ends, and that is why I gave it such a low rating.


Solid Plot: 8

I really liked how they were able to keep a solid and consistent plot both of the main story and each individual arc.


Moral: 8

Black Butler touched on a lot of dark and realistic themes which is why I can’t understand why it was rated PG 13. However one of the more ‘childish’ themes even though it was illustrated in such a dark manner, is that no matter who you are, where you are or where you’re from we are all human and we all shed the same color blood


Sense: 5

I can’t say this anime made no sense yet it also didn’t make perfect sense. For starters there are just too many questions left unanswered towards the end of the Anime. Such as (SPOILERS?) why don’t they take the collar off of the demon dog and why is the queen so young; along with many others. 


Music: 8

The music of Black Butler was amazing, the openings as well as the ending have go to be up there with my top 5. Also the music was very complimentary to the mood of the scene, the pitch and tone would rise and fall depending on the pace of the scene which was very nice to see.


Art: 8

Absolutely loved the art of Black Butler, no two characters looked the same and also the art work in general was done very well


Characters: 9

The highest point for Black Butler seeing as each main character was given a full background and we also got to witness their background. Character progression was also very nice seeing as they don’t all stay the same from episode 1 up to episode 24. Characters gain maturity, respect and love for one another.


Boredom/Captivation Scale: 8

I quite enjoyed this anime except for the ending which really let it down, if it had a better ending then I would have loved it even more.


Personal Score: 7

A 7 only due to the fact that the ending ruined it for me, and the way I see it the ending of an anime takes up about 70% of the score as it affects everything with rating the main criteria. However with that said would I recommend this anime? A hard question because even though it was generally good I honestly said to myself “what a waste of time” after watching the ending. So yes and no; if you've got nothing better to do with your day and just want an Anime to watch that will take up time then watch this, however if you’re looking for an Anime for a smashing start and banging ending then I don’t recommend this.



Genres

Comedy: 7

The funny scenes where generally funny and sometime had me ‘rolling over laughing’ 


Action: 8

Action scenes where packed with a lot of fighting and a lot of Hollywood style kills. (he kills people with silver ware)


Supernatural: 7

The average type of supernatural yet with its own twist. We have Angels, Demons, Ghost, Mystery killers and even a demon dog.

Just now finished watching the last episode of this anime.The storyline is totally different from the animes I have watched till now.Excellent story,all the characters were created pretty well.The bond between the butler Sebastian and the Young master Ciel is pretty interesting.The background music perfectly fits the scenario shown in the anime.When I watch this anime it feels like I am watching a thriller movie.
Story begins with a 10 year old boy named Ciel who made a deal with a demon to avenge his parent's murder in exchange for his soul,and throughout the journey the demon served him well as his butler.In the end Cielgets his revenge and the demon/butler Sebastian gets Ciel's soul as part of the deal.The end really made me cry but it was a perfect ending keeping in mind the story.Overall its a superb anime with very few deformities  and that's why  I love , love ,love this anime a lot.

Kuroshitsuji is my first love, I watched this anime due to a friend suggesting it to me. At the time i had never watched anime and was pretty much completely Sherlock obsessed, this anime basically changed everything for me. 
The story is very similar to that of Sherlock Holmes in the beginning but as the characters develop and the story line unfolds it grips your attention so much so that it's hard to stop watching. 
The main characters Ciel and Sebastian and are easy to fall in love with even though they both have complex backgrounds, there is a strong theme of mystery through outthis anime and i suppose that's one of the reasons its so gripping. \n\n
Overall this anime will always be my favourite due to the perfect graphics, thrilling story line and supernatural nature, I recommend this to absolutely anyone. \n\n
Keeping this in mind, i find this anime to be one that can have you in tears one moment and giggling the next, it brings out a lot of emotions and that's exactly what caught my attention. During the first few episodes i was unsure about whether to carry on watching, number one because it was the middle of the night and it was pretty creepy but also because i had never watched something quite like it. Slowly as the story unfolded though i found myself thrown into the world of Kuroshitsuji and i regret nothing.

This anime was brilliant, the story line was brilliant with a beautiful thick plot, involving some gruesome characters, and I believe, a transvestite/Cross Dresser aswell. However as the anime is set in 18th century England, I found that the accents were a little over done (I know this, because i'm English), but other than that its enjoyable. 
I would definitely recommend this anime :)

This is by far one of the best anime i have ever seen! It has something new around every corner that is sure to be valued by most and is very hard to predict. Although the overall story has a dark and eerie mood it often has moments of hilarity. It is violent at times and has a very deep back story for many characters as well as occasional interesting subplots. I would recommend it to anyone,

Set in England during the Victorian Era we meet a 12 year old Earl named Ciel Phantomhive and his demon butler named Sebastion that he made a contract with until Ciel's goal has been acclomplished.
Story: 9/10
I really enjoyed the story of Ciel's parents getting killed and how he made the contract with Sebastion and he would give Sebastion his soul once he found out who killed his parents.
Animation: 10/10
I really liked the animation. I liked how dark and gothic the animation could be and it gave off a goth vibe. The victorian-era background was also done really nicely.
Sound: 8/10
The sound is very good. I lovedthe opening song of this show and enjoyed the 2nd ending of ths show but i did not understand the 1st ending of the song. It did not fit well with the show and was way to preppy in my opinion.\n\n
Charechters: 8/10\n\n
I enjoyed pretty much all the charechters in the show, my favorite being Sebastion.  The one i could not stand though was Ciel's cousion/fiancee Lizzy, she annoyed me so much and she always whined and acted like a brat when she didn't get her way. Luckily she was barley on the show.\n\n
Overal:8/10\n\n
Overall i enjoyed the show very much and it's my favorite anime.

Not only was this the best anime I have ever watched, but it was also the first. I enjoyed learning about Ciel Phantomhive and his demon butler Sebastian Michaelis. As the story progressed and more dark secrets were revealed the action kicked up and the show was overtaken by amazing fight scenes. I give this anime the highest possible rating and recommend it to all.
